hanzi-su-wiki:
遣

Значения

Применять; держать на работе (службе); расходовать; заниматься чем-либо; принимать (ванну, пищу); посылать; давать, дарить; делать

Мнемоника

Ссылка 辶 на строительство стены 阜 (без нижней части), где таскают землю в носилках с подвешенной на оглоблях корзиной (сверху). Опустишь оглоблю, и земля высыплется сама.

humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from the second " and " from " 𠂤 ", " 𠂤 " is " division " of the classical, " and " hand-shaped, ancient army known as "divisions and brigades", his hands like a conductor of shape, it will send troops intended. The original meaning is dispatch.

" Again " or " claw ", are like hands; or added from " mouth ". Bronze inscriptions add "辵" or "彳" on the basis of " 𠳋 " as a sign, which means walking.

Oracle uses the word " stunned " to indicate fault (Cai Zhemao). Bronze inscriptions were used as the names of people and also meant to be dispatched, Ming Gongzun: "Only the king ordered Ming Gong to send the three tribes to fight the eastern kingdom." It is also commonly used as " stunned " to indicate negligence, and Da Baogui: "Da Bao Ke Jing is sent away." It also means a funeral object. "Returning a car" refers to a special vehicle (Dai Jiaxiang) for sending burial goods, and "returning a car" refers to a water vessel for burial. "Rituals.旣Xi": "The book is sent to the policy." Note: "It is still sent."

"Shuowen": "Qian, Zongye. Cong辵, 𠳋 sound."

humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從二「又」從「𠂤」，「𠂤」是「師」之古文，「又」是手形，古代軍隊又稱「師旅」，兩手象指揮之形，會派遣軍隊之意。本義是派遣。

　　「又」或作「爪」，皆象手形；或加從「口」。金文在「𠳋」基礎上加「辵」或「彳」為意符，有行走之意。

　　甲骨文通作「愆」，表示有過失(蔡哲茂)。金文用作人名，又表示派遣，明公尊：「唯王命明公遣三族伐東國」。又通作「愆」，表示過失，大保簋：「大保克敬亡遣」。又表示送葬之物，「遣車」即送殉葬品之專用車(戴家祥)，「遣盉」即殉葬的水器。《儀禮．旣夕》：「書遣于策。」註：「遣，猶送也。」

　　《說文》：「遣，縱也。从辵，𠳋聲。」

Meaning Mnemonic
On the scooter is an insect and a bear. The bear immediately stomps the insect, squishing it flat. "My god, the insect is smashed. Someone call dispatch!"
Imagine the conversation with emergency services. They say they will dispatch an ambulance immediately.
Reading Mnemonic
Out of the dispatched ambulance jumps Ken (けん) the samurai. "Dispatch sent me! I'm here to fix that insect."
He takes out a very tiny katana and performs surgery right there. The insect dies on the scooter. "It looks like I've dispatched this insect to the afterlife."
